Sounds like you're talking about supporting some type of bulk operation(s).=


I sometimes fashion a media type that supports bulk operations by
definin=
g a <bulk /> element that can contains <add />, <update />, and
<remove /> =
sections. I then define usually define a specific resource
for bulk operati=
ons: (/services/;bulk) and POST the representation
there. I've also POSTed =
the representation to the collection root
(/services), too.

Biggest hassle=
 w/ bulk operations is that it reduces visibility on the
wire. caches are n=
ot going to understand that you've removed (added,
updated) each item since=
 that's buried in the representation. If you
use ETags, you'll have a fallb=
ack to help caches, but sometimes that's
not enough.

BTW, Subbu's RESTful =
Web Services Cookbook covers this scenario pretty
well (CH 11, i think)
